item.title: Setting up Security Engineering for success
item.description: In this post I summarize the challenges I faced in implementing application security both from a technical and an organizational point of view. I also wrap up a few helpful ideas. Challenge 1: Software Development culture Nowadays devs are evaluated and rewarded mainly for their proficiency with modern languages/frameworks and “coding” abilities, while security skills are typically not mentioned. A too large percentage of devs are either not skilled enough on security topics or they lack the will to pull in security considerations, compared to what they’d do for other requirements, such as performance, scalability, etc.

item.title: Nesty Loops
item.description: In this example we will be using KaTeX Create a partial under /layouts/partials/math.html Within this partial reference the Auto-render Extension or host these scripts locally. Include the partial in your templates like so: {{ if or .Params.math .Site.Params.math }} {{ partial "math.html" . }} {{ end }} To enable KaTex globally set the parameter math to true in a project’s configuration To enable KaTex on a per page basis include the parameter math: true in content files Note: Use the online reference of Supported TeX Functions

item.title: Null safety
item.description: Null safety is an emerging feature of modern programming languages, which is taking much tracton lately. Notable examples include Kotlin, Swift and Dart 2.0.
